function_call.name: classify_risks_PESTLE
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Anonymous surveys used for evaluation may inadvertently collect sensitive personal data.","category":"Data Privacy and Security risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Commonsense information about environmental conditions may not account for disease transmission factors.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Sharing of links to various websites","category":"Data Privacy and Security risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Minimization of danger in route planning","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Promotion of covid-19 route tracking","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"High infection rate and asymptomatic infection of covid-19","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Difficulty in estimating epidemiology parameters in the early stages of the outbreak","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Complexity and variation in epidemic models, making it difficult to predict future epidemic situations accurately","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of spatiotemporal description in epidemic models","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Incorporation of asymptomatic infectors and environmental infection in dynamic transmission models","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate explanation of mapping between model parameters and practical significance of interventions","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Neglect of spatial information in modeling epidemic interventions","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of consideration for the spatiotemporal evolution of covid-19 in intervention studies","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Mode of transmission through close contact","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Use of mobile phone location data for forecasting epidemics","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Utilization of ecological niche model enm for identifying potential risk zones","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Difficulty in obtaining detailed observation data of crowds and resident activity in public health and safety emergencies","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Backtracking problem in current epidemic-related data","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inability to establish observation strategies and scientific methods aligned with reality in public health emergencies","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Late and lax epidemic prevention and control measures abroad","category":"Political risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Assumption about the means of transmission of covid-19","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Discussion of the status of the spread of covid-19 using early reported case data from the u.k., the u.s., spain, and germany","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Evaluation of the effect of hospital isolation measures based on hospital spatiotemporal distribution","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Change from pcr fluorescence probing to clinical diagnosis without justification","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Uncertainty and irregular shape of traditional unit for quarantine measures","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Irregular shape and data acquisition difficulty may lead to ineffective grid regions for disease control and prevention.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Unrestricted contact between people within the grid boundaries before quarantine implementation.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Insufficient control over the distribution of the grid may limit the practical scope of quarantine measures.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of quarantine measures allowing unrestricted diffusion of covid-19","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate monitoring and control of infected individuals","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Complex spatiotemporal model equations may be prone to errors in implementation and interpretation, leading to inaccurate disease spread predictions.","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate understanding of the distribution of infected humans in each grid region may lead to ineffective evaluation of intervention effects.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Reliance on quarantine measures, testing, and personal protective equipment without effective assessment of their impact and implications for disease spread.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Spatial correlation of human activity and environmental factors affecting transmission of infectious diseases.","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Spatial correlation of infectious disease transmission due to people’s living and work locations","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Infection spread from adjacent space to surrounding regions","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Transmission patterns leading to time series change in the number of newly infected people","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Tobler’s first law of geography influencing covid-19 transmission","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Complex mathematical equations for calculating infectious grid cell weight","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate implementation of self-protection measures such as wearing face masks, hand washing, and ventilation","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inaccurate understanding or implementation of effective self-protection measures","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Spatial distribution of hospitals and number of beds impact covid-19 spread.","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Insufficient data for epidemic modeling","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Unreliable early stage estimated number of infected humans due to unknown virus characteristics and rapid interventions.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Differences in patterns of movement of crowds and levels of economic development make it difficult to clarify which country’s data are most appropriate for simulating the trend of covid-19.","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Insufficient sample data due to short time period and unknown infection rates","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Large-scale detection program leading to underreporting of asymptomatic cases","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Uncertainty in using early small sample data to predict the epidemic situation","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Differences in population distribution, population flow, and medical resource detection affecting the spread of early epidemic","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Difficulty in confirming the actual number of infected people who had already exited but had not been tested or had no symptoms","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"}]}
